topics.body:
"I can't even...public shaming a young child"
!http://i.imgur.com/Rm09qmX.jpg!
"This young elementary school student was 1 minute late, so the teacher put him behind this barrier and wrote 'Tardy' on the other side."

"It was the 6th time they did this too him because he is often a little late due to his mothers unreliable car."

"When his mom arrived she found him crying and being teased. She wants an apology but the school has refused to do so."

One.
Minute.
Late.
And this is what the kid gets?
What a bunch of asshole teachers.
topics.author: 5446fcfc6368723ec21a0000

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f25e056368721c4f001300#post_54f25e056368721c4f001300
Most teachers have either become complete pushovers or totalitarian fuck-wits.
It's basic human psychology. Children respond better to POSITIVE reinforcement as opposed to NEGATIVE reinforcement. The whole "Spare the rod spoil the child" mentality is fucking retarded.  You damn the ACTION not the child.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f25e056368721c4f001300#post_54f25e056368721c4f001300
Yo, dude.

My school had only two ways to classes and both would reveal yourself towards everyone during assembly. That's strategy to humiliate students as either way you choose, everyone sees you and you become the target of the audience. I had to stand in front of everyone while the teacher does speeches and stuff which is pretty long. Once the assembly is done, we have to pick up trash around the area. Sometimes, the teacher would go to us and even ask us why we're late and mock us about it with the microphone.

That was elementary school. Which is why I wondered why my high school days aren't as tough as I thought.
